p: Enzootic transmission cycles have been described for the varieties ID, IE, Everglades, Mucambo, and Tonate (Bijou Bridge); all of which, with the exception of the Bijou Bridge, are transmitted and maintained in a cycle involving rodents and mosquitoes of the subgenus Culex ( Melanoconion) [ 25â€“ 27]. The Bijou bridge virus is transmitted by the insect, Oeciacus vicarius, to birds in western North America [ 28].
